children.subject: I am currently taking 161 + 186 + 188 + breadth + teaching and it is pretty doable. Tbh I would even say 162 + 127 + 2 breadths would be harder than my current schedule lol. If you are good at projects it should be pretty easy, I was able to finish all the projects in <10 hours and I have a lot of free time.

history.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm currently choosing which classes to take for next semester and thought I'd ask for some workload advice. Right now, I'm split between taking 161 + 186 + 2 breadths vs taking 161 + 186 + 188 + 1 breadth (basically replacing a breadth with 188). My current semester is 162 + 127 + 2 breadths and so far it's been a very easy workload wise semester. Another thing that might be relevant is that I'm generally better at system/programming classes in comparison to theoretical classes.

Do you guys think the 3 techs workload would be doable? Please keep in mind that I will also be going through the recruiting process for a job (incoming senior).

Another question I wanted to ask people who've previously taken these classes is which ones should I Phase 1? Should I Phase 1 all three techs or is there one of them that you know you can comfortably get in even with Phase 2? Since that would allow me to Phase 1 a breadth that has really high demand.
history.subject: 161/186/188 workload?
